channel.title: 1 processes are unconfined but have a profile defined
channel.description:
I'm apparmor newbie. I have run aa-genprof lighttpd weeks ago and put it into complain mode. Today, after I switch it into enforce mode, on the output of aa-status, I see the captioned line. (Well, I ran aa-logprof several times in between. I always avoid doing something I don't understand so I quit chickenly everytime.) I have a couple of questions that are not mentioned in most of apparmor know-how googled.
1. How can I confine that process? I only have its pid (which is not permanent by nature). 2. If I run multiple times of aa-logprof, does the "learning" cumulated? or only the last run counts? 3. Just notice there is a package apparmor-profiles-extra. Should I install it? Does it carry official profile for lighttpd, and will it overwrite the existing one if it does?
Thanks a lot for any help.

item.title: 1 processes are unconfined but have a profile defined
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Also the apparmor support may be helpful.

Read full topic

Don’t encounter them on my google results.

item.title: 1 processes are unconfined but have a profile defined
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi vvong

How to use apparmor can be sourted out as per the https://whonix.org/wiki/Support#Free_Support_Principle

I would start by:

  • searching for the answer without the Whonix part of the question. Since Whonix is based on Debian OS you may want to search for “How to use apparmor in Debian”

  • Read Whonix apparmor wiki: https://whonix.org/wiki/AppArmor

  • Search Whonix apparmor subforum: https://forums.whonix.org/c/apparmor

  • Ubuntu is base on Debian so this may be helpful…https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingApparmor

  • Debian apparmor wiki: https://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/debian-handbook/sect.apparmor.da.html

  • Debian apparmor.d - syntax of security profiles: https://manpages.debian.org/stretch/apparmor/apparmor.d.5.en.html

Please note:

Users can also utilize {apparmor} profiles by other vendors, but this is unsupported by Whonix developers.

Whonix

Unsupported

What do you mean by unsupported?

Read full topic
item.source: 1 processes are unconfined but have a profile defined

item.title: 1 processes are unconfined but have a profile defined
item.dc:creator: vvong
item.description:
I’m apparmor newbie.
I have run aa-genprof lighttpd weeks ago and put it into complain mode.
Today, after I switch it into enforce mode, on the output of aa-status, I see the captioned line. (Well, I ran aa-logprof several times in between. I always avoid doing something I don’t understand so I quit chickenly everytime.)
I have a couple of questions that are not mentioned in most of apparmor know-how googled.

  1. How can I confine that process? I only have its pid (which is not permanent by nature).
  2. If I run multiple times of aa-logprof, does the “learning” cumulated? or only the last run counts?
  3. Just notice there is a package apparmor-profiles-extra. Should I install it? Does it carry official profile for lighttpd, and will it overwrite the existing one if it does?

Thanks a lot for any help.
